org.gicentre.geomap.io

Class ShapefileReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gicentre.geomap.io.ShapefileReader

  • public class ShapefileReader
extends java.lang.Object
    Readers an ESRI shapefile and populates a GeoMap object with its features and attributes. A shapefile should consist of 3 separate files - name.shp containing the geometry; name.shx containing the file offsets for the components that make up the geometry; and name.dbf containing the attributes.
    Version:
    3.2, 4th March, 2017.
    Author:
    Jo Wood, giCentre, City University of London.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ShapefileReader(processing.core.PApplet parent)
      Creates a shapefile reader that will scale any geographic data read to be within the given bounds.

      Use getAttributeTable instead that uses Processing's own Table class to store attributes.

      Provides the features that have been extracted from the shapefile.

      Reports the maximum geographic value in the x-direction.

      Reports the maximum geographic value in the y-direction.

      Reports the minimum geographic value in the x-direction.

      Reports the minimum geographic value in the y-direction.
      int getNumLines()
      Reports the number of line objects that have been read by this reader.
      int getNumPoints()
      Reports the number of point objects that have been read by this reader.
      int getNumPolys()
      Reports the number of polygon objects that have been read by this reader.

      Reads the given shapefile (requires stream representing the .shp file and the .dbf file).

      • ShapefileReader

        public ShapefileReader(processing.core.PApplet parent)
        Creates a shapefile reader that will scale any geographic data read to be within the given bounds.
        Parameters:
        parent - Parent sketch that will draw the data to be read.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public boolean read(java.io.InputStream geomInputStream,
                    java.io.InputStream dbInputStream)
        Reads the given shapefile (requires stream representing the .shp file and the .dbf file).
        Parameters:
        geomInputStream - Input stream representing the geometry (.shp) file.
        dbInputStream - Input stream representing the attributes (.dbf) file.
        Returns:
        True if shapefiles were read successfully.

      • getFeatures

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Feature> getFeatures()
        Provides the features that have been extracted from the shapefile.
        Returns:
        Map that contains the features indexed by ID.

      • getAttributes

        @Deprecated
public AttributeTable getAttributes()
        Deprecated. Use getAttributeTable instead that uses Processing's own Table class to store attributes.
        Provides the attribute table that has been extracted from the shapefile. Now this method is deprecated, it may be slower than previously as it creates a new deprecated version of the table each time it is called.
        Returns:
        Attribute table from shapefile.

      • getAttributeTable

        public processing.data.Table getAttributeTable()
        Provides the attribute table that has been extracted from the shapefile.
        Returns:
        Attribute table from shapefile.

      • getNumPoints

        public int getNumPoints()
        Reports the number of point objects that have been read by this reader.

        public int getNumLines()

        Returns:
        Number of line objects read.

      • getNumPolys

        public int getNumPolys()
        Reports the number of polygon objects that have been read by this reader. Note that a complex polygon with several parts will be considered a single object.
        Returns:
        Number of polygon objects read.
